body:
> This works, but why not change
> 
> https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/8bc30da6211df67ee8bec21e160ce587817ba85b/superset-frontend/src/dashboard/components/SliceHeaderControls.jsx#L136
> 
> to `disabled={this.props.chartStatus !== 'loading'}`?

Chart's initial state is "loading":
https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/291306392443a5a0d0e2ee0cc4a95d37c56d4589/superset-frontend/src/chart/chartReducer.js#L24

Wasn't that the intention? I asked because [the original commit](https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/commit/6ec9e1a4e94beb1d6a1f49e25569473ba99715c1) that introduced this disabled state says:

* [Dashboard] disable force refresh when chart is still loading

yeah, i think it's reasonable to check if current chart status === "loading".  
Added fix.

I wonder if it could make existing environments look bad. Definitely don't want to force adjustments on others.

In our case we could just tweak https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/config.py#L179-L180 from `126` to `92` seems to do it

@mistercrunch I tried the F.A.B permission customization based on #7501 and the link which you shared.
@dpgaspar 

Need your comments on what am I missing.


Steps I followed:
1. Change the class permission
2. set FAB_UPDATE_PERMS = False
3. flask fab security-converge
4. superset db upgrade

But seems like the situation is still.
![Screenshot from 2020-03-31 03-30-03](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20752142/77966192-253a6680-7300-11ea-81d2-78e08250a6c7.png)
![Screenshot from 2020-03-31 03-19-14](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/20752142/77966194-266b9380-7300-11ea-80be-00ec5744b170.png)
lgtm!
@john-bodley this might be interesting to you
rm -rf ~/.superset
rm -rf ~/.superset
Is this still in progress?
@john-bodley current behavior before this pr seems to modify username in url so it expects all users to have same password as the generic acct !?

This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions. For admin, please label this issue `.pinned` to prevent stale bot from closing the issue.

Uninstall and rm -rf ~/.superset，then install successfully
``` shell
# Download anaconda: https://www.anaconda.com/distribution/#linux
$ bash ~/Download/Anaconda3-2020.02-Linux-x86_64.sh
# Create conda env
$ conda create -n superset python=3.7
# Activate env
$ conda activate superset
# Install superset
$ pip install apache-superset
# Install flask-appbuilder
$ pip install flask-appbuilder
# Install necessary modules
$ pip install wtforms_json flask_compress celery flask_migrate flask_talisman flask_caching sqlparse bleach markdown numpy pandas parsedatetime pathlib2 simplejson humanize python-geohash polyline geopy cryptography backoff msgpack pyarrow contextlib2 croniter retry selenium isodate
# Initialize the database
$ superset db upgrade 
# Create an admin user # fabmanager create-admin --app superset
$ export FLASK_APP=superset
$ flask fab create-admin
# Load some data to play with
$ superset load_examples
# Create default roles and permissions
$ superset init
# To start a development web server on port 8088, use -p to bind to another port
$ superset run -p 8088 --with-threads --reload --debugger
Still useful
@rangerzhou I'm glad you found a workaround. If it seems like this was a temporary issue, would it be OK to close this issue?

@pure-zests it might be better to bind Superset to 127.0.0.1 so that it's inaccessible from outside the local loopback. Then you can bind Apache to 80 and 443, and have Apache handle the redirect from HTTP -> HTTPS. If you need to handle the redrect from 9020, I'd recommend moving Superset to another port and again handling the redirect in Apache. I hope this helps!

@gbrian you are free to extend the Python configuration as described in [the documentation] https://superset.apache.org/installation.html#configuration - as the configuration is a Python file, it is possible to tell Superset to look for environment variables for any configuration option. I hope this approach will work for you!
@tooptoop4 you could do something similar to https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/9405 to achieve what you require which also updates `connect_args`.
@micimize would you be willing to open a PR, given that you have a patch in place?

> @villebro you mentioned,
> 
> > To simplify the query object and viz controls, it makes sense to group these together and always perform grouping if at least one metric is present.
> 
> Why must you perform a grouping in only metric is present?

@john-bodley I was actually thinking about adding a `force_groupby`, but decided against it at this point as there didn't seem to be any visualizations that were depending on this functionality currently. I anticipate we will probably also need to introduce a `distinct` flag at some point, but for now I would prefer to keep these PRs as contained as possible.
@zhaoyu89730105 We are looking for similar functionality in superset, we'd love to have this feature!

@john-bodley this should be ready for another round of review.
Holler if this is still an issue, and we can re-open it if needed.
Hi @petacube - we do test install on a regular basis. Please provide all of the information requested in the bug report issue template so that the project maintainers can better assist you.

python 3.7
macos 10.13
anaconda distribusion. 

everything else in the initial report


> On Apr 1, 2020, at 1:08 PM, Will Barrett <notifications@github.com> wrote:
> 
> 
> Hi @petacube <https://github.com/petacube> - we do test install on a regular basis. Please provide all of the information requested in the bug report issue template so that the project maintainers can better assist you.
> 
> —
> You are receiving this because you were mentioned.
> Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub <https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/issues/9390#issuecomment-607375108>, or unsubscribe <https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/AHHF6KQ6LP4CS2UBP6OVDLLRKNYH3ANCNFSM4LT6EM5A>.
>
Thanks @petacube - Superset does not support Python 3.7. We are on 3.6. Please try with a supported Python version and let us know if your issue persists.

Can you point to where this issue was reported, for context?

edit: nevermind I see, the discussion was on the original PR.

Having an hard time to reproduce the issue. Are user's getting this when coming from dashboards? can user's view the charts on the chart list?

Note: HTTP 404, means that the chart does not exist or it's being filtered by the already in-place filter.
Do user's have datasource access or schema access or all datasource access to the datasource related to the chart?

Following logic, can't be sure, are you certain that the revert solves the issue?

I also made change to the Big Number controls here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/pull/9341

It seems there will be conflicts. Which one should we merge first?

@aguspina this looks like a temporary failure. The system is timing out when attempting to download dependencies from pypi.org. Are you perhaps on an internet connection that's not super reliable? Maybe pypi ran into issues?
@betodealmeida bump - is this still required?
I'll merge the other one first then since this one's ci is still broken.
@ktmud it looks like this change introduced some typing issues that were surfaced by mypi.

Not really sure why CI is failing on this one (was actually just starting to look into it and try reproducing locally)... I just restarted Travis to see if I get lucky ;)

Happy to rebase (or even re-do) these changes on an updated `master`
Hi @jiegzhan - please fill out all of the required information in the issue template to help the maintainers better assist you.

> @ktmud it looks like this change introduced some typing issues that were surfaced by mypi.

Indeed. I'm working on a fix.
Hi @sunnysnowhi - the system loads examples from the internet, unfortunately. I'm not aware of another way to load examples.
@dpgaspar can you give this a look?
Maybe @rusackas would be interested too?
@rusackas @craig-rueda can you pin this?
You're right. Thanks!
I'm not super familiar with Presto, but I think @villebro or @john-bodley could probably answer this question.

Hi @durchgedreht - other than updating the logo in the header, Superset does not support theming at the moment. There is no workflow recommended for customizing the look and feel of Superset at this time.
Hi @dark-spark2 - thanks for the issue. Can you elaborate on your use-case for changing the base URL? Thanks!

I'm able to reproduce it the following way:
- Give users access to dashboards that contain charts they are able to access by having database access permission, and datasource permission.
- Low priv user Favorites the dashboard
- Remove the datasource access permission from the user/role.
- Users are not able to view these charts on the charts list view, but they can viz them on the dashboard
- Users use "Explore Chart" on the dashboard, and then click "Edit properties" and get HTTP 404.

This is caused by user's having access to viz charts by having the database access permission, but the chart filter does not include the database access filter, just schema, datasource or all datasources:

here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/charts/filters.py
and here: https://github.com/apache/incubator-superset/blob/master/superset/views/chart/filters.py

Can you confirm this reasoning?

Possible path forward could be to add the database access to this filter, and assume this is the new security filter in-place for charts

Other path: could be the front end disables the edit properties if the backend returns 404

Hi @willbarrett - I am trying to deploy superset as docker on kubernetes cluster with istio as ingress.
In istio, the process is to define 1 gateway and allow multiple applications to access from outside the cluster through that gateway. Since the cluster contains multiple application, in order to access superset I need to create baseUrl different from root. 
The inability to change the baseUrl prevents me from accessing through the istio gw with virtual service. So the only option to access the UI is through port-forwarding, something I can not share with product team.
Thanks!

@stevensotelo glad you're interested! Currently, most Apache projects use Travis for CI. Travis has limited support for Windows builds. @Nathandrake01 if you're downloading via SQL Lab, you'll want to set a LIMIT on the query. Queries without LIMITs are automatically limited to the value of `DEFAULT_SQLLAB_LIMIT` - providing a larger LIMIT inside the query text will override that setting.
